thread.title: Flights near Syria face crossfire fears
thread.title_full: Flights near Syria face crossfire fears

title: Flights near Syria face crossfire fears
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Flights near Syria face crossfire fears Russia stepped up its involvement in the Syrian crisis last week AP Russia stepped up its involvement in the Syrian crisis last week AP Will Humphries Published at 12:01AM, October 13 2015 
Safety alerts have been issued to airlines using busy routes over Iran, Iraq and the Caspian Sea amid fears that commercial aircraft could become caught in the crossfire of Russian cruise missile strikes. 
Russia stepped up its involvement in the Syrian crisis last week, prompting global aviation officials to act. The International Civil Aviation Organisation (ICAO), the UN air safety arm, and Eurocontrol, the pan-European air traffic control agency, issued warnings about the routes that link Europe with the Middle East, the Gulf States and Asia. 
Some airlines have begun diverting planes over the safer airspace of Saudi Arabia and Subscribe now
